fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.histories

Class LinearInterpolatorGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.histories.LinearInterpolatorGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI

    public class LinearInterpolatorGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements IncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI
    The class LinearInterpolatorGenerator implements an order 1 polynomial interpolator.

    Description

    This generator creates simple order 1 polynomial to be used to define piecewise linear functions defined over points where only the abcissa and the ordinate are known.

    Glass-box Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2021-12-09

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      • generateInterpolationFunction

        public Piece generateInterpolationFunction(double x1,
                                           double t1,
                                           double x2,
                                           double t2)
        compute an interpolated function f(t) between the two given points.

        Contract

         pre     t1 < t2
 post    ret.in(t1) && ret.in(t2) && ret.assertValueEquals(t1, x1) && ret.assertValueEquals(t2, x2)
        Specified by:
        generateInterpolationFunction in interface IncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI
        Parameters:
        x1 - function value at t1.
        t1 - first function parameter.
        x2 - function value at t2.
        t2 - second function parameter.
        Returns:
        a piece interpolating between the two given points.
        See Also:
        IncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI.generateInterpolationFunction(double, double, double, double)

      • generateInterpolationExtension

        public Piece generateInterpolationExtension(java.util.Vector<Piece> pieces,
                                            double x,
                                            double t)
        add a new point to an existing interpolated function f(t) represented as a series of pieces.

        Contract

         pre     pieces != null && pieces.size() > 0
 pre     pieces.lastElement().after(t)
 post    ret.in(t) && ret.followsImmediately(pieces.lastElement()) && ret.assertValueEquals(t, x)
        Specified by:
        generateInterpolationExtension in interface IncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI
        Parameters:
        pieces - existing series of pieces representing the interpolated function to be extended.
        x - function value at t.
        t - new time at which x corresponds.
        Returns:
        a new piece that can be added to extend pieces.
        See Also:
        IncrementalInterpolatorGeneratorI.generateInterpolationExtension(java.util.Vector, double, double)
